Message.Title: Rename Dell to Icahn
Message.Msg: I never really liked the Dell name. It looks like a cheap generic last name, Icahn actually looks and sounds better to me. I hope Icahn changes the name soon.
My favorite name is Hosed. The ads can say, "Hey dude, you're getting Hosed."
Icahn is old for this tech I wonder if he knows how to turn a computer on ?

Message.Title: If Icahn believes Dell is worth $14, he should show us the money
Message.Msg: instead of asking to use company cash and debt. USE HIS OWN MONEY.

Topic.Title: If Icahn believes Dell is worth $14, he should show us the money

Message.Msg: if shareholders don't believe the company is worth 13.65 they should sell their shares to MD. Problem solved. Let the stock market sort out who wants to sell or buy shares. It is disingenuous for MD to force shareholders to sell and then claim it is for their own good. MD wants another IPO. That is all this is about.

Yeah...sure...remember that the Icahn deal is only for 1.1 billion shares...not ALL...and if you think that the retail investor will see that $14...you would be sadly mistaken. Funds will get first shot...after all Icahn will have to make the money people happy first....AND it will give them an opportunity to bail. Now, with DELL saddled with a tremendous amount of debt...the retail investors will be left....how much do you think the pps will be then? I just don't know...I am voting for Dell....GLTA

Message.Title: Carl Icahn stats
Message.Msg: I know it's not a lot to go for.... but over the past five years 89% of the times Carl Icahn bought shares in a company (285 buys in 12 different ones) the price was up after six months by on average of 15%(that is average, means also the price was higher than that). that is not enough to put your money but it does make you think.... by the way anyone wants to know how I got this numbers I checked it at insiderbee, but also I can show in general if you want
Icahn has done a great job for shareholders over the years! Motorola, ImClone, Chesapeake, etc. VOTE WITH ICAHN!!!
You're forgetting NFLX?
